problems.problem: Two masses are connected to each other and the tip of a rotating rod by massless strings as shown. The mass (10kg) closer to the rod travels in a circle of radius 1 meter, with its axis being the rod. The mass (10kg) further away travels similarly in a circle of radius 2 meters. If the angular velocity of the two masses is sqrt(10) radians per second, find the tension in the string connecting the rod to the mass closest to it. (Assume g=10m/s^2)<center><svg height="200" width="200"><line x1="25" y1="25" x2="25" y2="200" style="stroke:rgb(0,0,0);stroke-width:6" /><line x1="25" y1="25" x2="100" y2="100" style="stroke:rgb(0,0,0);stroke-width:2" /><line x1="175" y1="130" x2="100" y2="100" style="stroke:rgb(0,0,0);stroke-width:2" /><circle cx="100" cy="100" r="10" stroke="black" stroke-width="0" fill="gray" /><circle cx="175" cy="130" r="10" stroke="black" stroke-width="0" fill="gray" /></svg></center>
